intro: Conospermum taxifolium var. lavandulifolium, commonly known as the lavender-leaf conospermum, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, aromatic leaves that resemble lavender foliage, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink to white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardy nature in temperate climates.
